Nokia Extensions for JSR-257

SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.innovision.rf
Interface JewelTagConnection

All Superinterfaces:
javax.microedition.contactless.TagConnection
public interface JewelTagConnection
extends javax.microedition.contactless.TagConnection

JewelTagConnection interface defines the necessary methods for reading and writing data and for other basic operations of the Innovision's Jewel RFID IC.

The Jewel's memory is arranged as number of memory areas (depending on the model) – 8 byte blocks or 16 blocks segments (models having 1024 bytes or more of memory). The basic read and write operations defined in this interface require the knowledge of what kind of memory map the each of the Jewel model has.

However, there are also logical read and write operations for accessing user memory that abstract the underlying memory map of the tag. These operations use the logical addressing where the first byte of the user memory data has the logical address 0 and the last data has the address getUserMemorySize()-1.

Moreover, there are methods for setting lock bits for user memory blocks (and segments in later Jewel models), setting the OTP bits and for reading various information from the Jewel tag like getting the header ROM and UID bytes and the size of the user memory available) that alleviate the communication with the tag.

Note that writing is only supported if the tag is NDEF capable.

Field Detail

IRT5001

static final int IRT5001
Constant code for IRT5001W and IRT5001E Jewel tags. Its value (1) corresponds to the tag's first header byte.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

Method Detail

getJewelType

int getJewelType()
Gets the part number code of the Jewel tag. The code is one of the constans defined in this API.

Returns:
the jewel part number code.
See Also:
IRT5001, IRT5002, IRT5003, IRT5004, IRT5005, IRT5006

getHeader

byte[] getHeader()
Gets the 2 header ROM bytes. The order of the header bytes in the array is as follows: HR-0, HR-1.

Returns:
the header ROM byte array.

getUID

byte[] getUID()
Gets the 7 bytes long UID array. The order of the UID bytes in the array is as follows: UID-0, UID-1, ..., UID6.

Returns:
the UID byte array.

getUserMemorySize

int getUserMemorySize()
Gets the size of the Jewel's user memory.

Returns:
the size of the user memory.

read

int read(int address)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                java.io.IOException,
                javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Reads a byte from the specified physical address in the Jewel's memory.

Parameters:
address - the physical address of the byte to read.
Returns:
the read byte.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if address is out of range.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading fails.

read

byte[] read(int startAddress,
            int length)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   java.io.IOException,
                   javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Reads a byte sequence with the given length starting from the specified physical address in the Jewel's memory.

Parameters:
startAddress - the start address of the bytes to read.
length - the length of the byte sequence.
Returns:
the read bytes. The return value is never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length < 1 or the address of any of the bytes in the sequence is out of range.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading fails.

readLogical

byte[] readLogical(int startAddress,
                   int length)
                   throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                          java.io.IOException,
                          javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Reads a data byte sequence with the given length starting from the specified logical address in the Jewel's user memory. This method abstracts the Jewel's physical memory map and the implementation of the method takes care that data is read from the proper physical addresses.

Parameters:
startAddress - the logical start address of the bytes to read.
length - the length of the byte sequence.
Returns:
the read data bytes. The return value is never null.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the address of any of the bytes in the sequence is out of range.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading fails.

readAll

byte[] readAll()
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException

Reads Jewel tag's memory contents including the two header ROM bytes and returns them in an array of 122 bytes. The format of the array is as follows:

HR0, HR1, UID0 - UID7, Data0 - Data95, Internal0 - Internal7, LOCK0, LOCK1, OTP0 - OTP5

The extended memory available in the later Jewel models is ignored by this method.

Returns:
the read data. The return value is never null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading fails.

readBlockLockBits

byte[] readBlockLockBits()
                         throws java.io.IOException,
                                javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Reads all the Jewel's user memory area block lock bits and returns them in a byte array.

Returns:
the byte array containing the block lock bits. The return value is never null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading fails.

readSegmentLockBits

byte[] readSegmentLockBits()
                           throws java.io.IOException,
                                  javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Reads all the Jewel's user memory area segment lock bits and returns them in a byte array. Only Jewel Tags with 1024 KBs of user memory or more support this method.

Returns:
the byte array containing the block lock bits. The return value is never null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading fails.

isBlockWritable

boolean isBlockWritable(int blockNumber,
                        byte[] blockLockBits)
                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                               java.io.IOException,
                               javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Checks whether the specified page block is writable. The byte array parameter enables checking writability of an page without communicating with the tag by using the lock bits read earlier using the readBlockLockBits() method. If the array parameter is null then the lock bits are first read from the tag.

Parameters:
blockNumber - The number of the checked block.
blockLockBits - block lock bits of Jewel tag. null if not available.
Returns:
true if the given page is writable. false if not.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if blockNumber is out of bounds or the length of blockLockBits is not supported.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading block lock bits fails.

isSegmentWritable

boolean isSegmentWritable(int segmentNumber,
                          byte[] segmentLockBits)
                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                 java.io.IOException,
                                 javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Checks whether the specified page segment is writable. The byte array parameter enables checking writability of an page without communicating with the tag by using the lock bits read earlier using the readSegmentLockBits() method. If the array parameter is null then the lock bits are first read from the tag. Only Jewel Tags with 1024 KBs of user memory or more support this method.

Parameters:
segmentNumber - The number of the checked segment.
segmentLockBits - segment lock bits of Jewel tag. null if not available.
Returns:
true if the given page is writable. false if not.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if segmentNumber is out of bounds or the length of segmentLockBits is not supported.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading segment lock bits fails.

readOTP

byte[] readOTP()
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Reads the Jewel's 48 OTP (One Time Programmable) bits and returns them in a byte array containing the 6 OTP bytes in the following order: OTP0, OTP1, ..., OTP5.

Returns:
the byte array containing the OTP bits. The return value is never null.
Throws:
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if reading fails.

write

void write(int b,
           int address,
           boolean erase)
           throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Writes the given byte to the specified address in the Jewel's memory. The byte can only be written to an unlocked memory area or to a location holding unset lock bits or OTP bits. Moreover, the method makes it possible to choose whether or not the selected memory location is first erased before writing.

Parameters:
b - the byte to write.
address - the address of the byte.
erase - the boolean that decides whether or not the memory location is first erased before writing.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if address is out of range.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if writing fails.

write

void write(byte[] bytes,
           int startAddress,
           boolean erase)
           throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                  java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                  java.io.IOException,
                  javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Writes the given byte array to the Jewel's memory. The bytes can only be written to unlocked memory areas or to locations holding unset lock bits or OTP bits. The method makes it possible to choose whether or not the selected memory locations are first erased before writing.

Parameters:
bytes - the bytes to be written.
startAddress - the physical start address of the bytes data to write.
erase - the boolean deciding whether or not the memory location is first erased before writing.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if bytes is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the address of any of the bytes to write is out of range or bytes.length == 0.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if writing fails.

writeLogical

void writeLogical(byte[] data,
                  int startAddress,
                  boolean erase)
                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Writes the given data array to the Jewel's user memory. The bytes can only be written to unlocked user memory areas. This method abstracts the Jewel's physical memory map and the implementation of the method takes care that data is written to the proper physical addresses. The method makes it possible to choose whether or not the physical memory locations are first erased before writing.

Parameters:
data - the data to be written.
startAddress - the logical start address of the data to write.
erase - the boolean deciding whether or not the memory location is first erased before writing.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if data is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the address of any of the bytes to write is out of range or data.length == 0.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if writing fails.

writeOTPBit

void writeOTPBit(int bitNumber)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Writes the specified OTP (One Time Programmable) bit. The valid bit numbers are 0 - 47 where 0 is the LSB and 47 the MSB.

Parameters:
bitNumber - the bit to write.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if bitNumber is out of range.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if writing of the bit fails, for example, the bit was already set.

writeOTP

void writeOTP(byte[] otpBits)
              throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     java.io.IOException,
                     javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Writes the OTP (One Time Programmable) data area.

Parameters:
otpBits - the byte array containg OPT bits in 6 bytes in the following order: OTP0, OTP1, ..., OTP5.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if otpBits is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of otpBits is not 6 bytes (48 bits).
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if writing of the bits fails, for example, some of the bits were already set.

lockBlock

void lockBlock(int blockNumber)
               throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Locks the specified user memory block so that the contents of the block cannot be changed anymore. After successful locking operation only reading the contents is possible.

Parameters:
blockNumber - the number of the memory block to lock.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if blockNumber is out of range.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if the locking operation failed, for example, the block was already locked.

lockSegment

void lockSegment(int segmentNumber)
                 throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                        java.io.IOException,
                        javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Locks the specified user memory segment so that the contents of the block cannot be changed anymore. After successful locking operation only reading the contents is possible. Only Jewel Tags with 1024 KBs of user memory or more support this method.

Parameters:
segmentNumber - the number of the memory segment to lock.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if segmentNumber is out of range.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if the locking operation failed, for example, the segment was already locked.

lockBlocks

void lockBlocks(int[] blockNumbers)
                throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                       java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                       java.io.IOException,
                       javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Locks the specified user memory blocks so that the contents of the blocks cannot be changed anymore. It is possible to lock only non locked data blocks. After successful locking operation only reading the contents is possible.

Parameters:
blockNumbers - the numbers of the memory blocks to lock.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if blockNumbers is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some of the block numbers is out of range or there are duplicates in the array.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if the locking operation failed, for example, some of the blocks were already locked.

lockSegments

void lockSegments(int[] segmentNumbers)
                  throws java.lang.NullPointerException,
                         java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                         java.io.IOException,
                         javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException
Locks the specified memory segments so that the contents of the segments cannot be changed anymore. It is possible to lock only non locked data segments. After successful locking operation only reading the contents is possible. Only Jewel Tags with 1024 KBs of user memory or more support this method.

Parameters:
segmentNumbers - the numbers of the memory segments to lock.
Throws:
java.lang.NullPointerException - if segmentNumbers is null.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if some of the segment numbers is out of range or there are duplicates in the array.
java.io.IOException - if a connection error occurs.
javax.microedition.contactless.ContactlessException - if the locking operation failed, for example, some of the segments were already locked.
